question: Falsely elevated ankle brachial index is used for evaluation of?
exp: Ankle brachial index always >1 If <= 0. 9 =indicates vascular insufficiency (Berger disease) Option 4- Calcified vessels will upgrade peripheral resistance so develop Pseudo hypertension So, ABI is also |

question: V. M. A levels are elevated in all except?
exp: Vanillylmandelicacid, urine(VMA) <15mg/gcreatinine Catecholaminesaresecretedin excessbypheochromocytomasand otherneuralcresttumors, andare metabolizedbytheenzymes monoamineoxidaseandcatechol-Omethyltransferaseto. VMA, whichis excretedinurine. Increasedin: Pheochromocytoma (64%sensitivity, 95%specificity), neuroblastoma, ganglioneuroma, generalizedanxiety. Decreasedin: Drugs: monoamine oxidaseinhibitors(MAOIs), eg, phenelzine. Elevated VMA level is suggestive of pheochromocytoma, but is not diagnostic. A normal VMA level does not rule out pheochromocytoma. Test is usually ordered along with homovanillic acid (HVA) on random urine sample for screening children for catecholamine-secreting tumors (eg, neuroblastoma) and other neural crest tumors, and for monitoring patients who have had treatment for these tumors.

question: Mobitz II heart block is seen with all except?
exp: Mobitz II | Damage to BOH at infranodal site Option A- Hypothyroidism - myxedema- Mobitz II Option B- Coronary aery disease= Ischemic - Mobitz II Option C- Sarcoidosis= Non caseating granuloma- Mobitz II

question: Hypertension with hypokalemic alkalosis is seen in?
exp: Liddle syndrome Gain of function of epithelial Na+ channels. More salt & water accumulating in body - Hypertension Loss of K+ and H+- Hypokalemic alkalosis Gitelman Defect in DCT Salt wasting, polyurea - BP cannot be | Baer Defect in thick ascending limb of loop of Henle Salt wasting, polyuria Normotension or | B. P | Aldosterone (2deg Aldosteronium) Hypokalemic, M. Alkalosis Fanconi syndrome/Renal tubular acidosis Type 2 Etiology- Wilson disease/Expiry date Tetracycline C/F: - Bicarbonaturia, salt wasting, M. Acidosis

question: Which of the following is true about factor V leiden mutation?
exp: Factor V Leiden mutation is hypercoagulable disorder characterized by deep venous thrombosis and pulmonary thromboembolism. Factor V becomes resistant to cleavage by protein C. It occurs due to arginine to glutamate substitution. Factor V deficiency is known as Para hemophilia.
opb: Factor V becomes resistant to cleavage by protein C

question: A 40 year old immunocompromised patient develops multiple ulcers in the oesophagus leading to painful swallowing. The biopsy from the oesophagus is shown below. The diagnosis is?
exp: Option A=CMV- there are Basophilic inclusion bodies & owl eye appearance seen in slide.
